meanings.definition: A person who believes in or advocates for the theory of mechanism in philosophy.
meanings.sent1: The mechanists in our class enjoy discussing how everything works mechanically.
meanings.sent2: The group of mechanists gathered to debate the principles of mechanism in philosophy.
meanings.sent3: The mechanists at the party had a lively debate about the inner workings of a clock.
meanings.sent4: She was a true mechanist, always seeing life as a series of mechanical processes.
meanings.sent5: The mechanists' belief in mechanism shaped their view of the world as a giant machine.

meanings.definition: A person who specializes in or practices mechanics.
meanings.sent1: The skilled mechanists fixed the broken engine in no time.
meanings.sent2: The mechanists at the workshop were busy repairing various machines.
meanings.sent3: The mechanists joked about having a magic touch when it came to fixing things.
meanings.sent4: He was a master mechanist, able to diagnose any mechanical issue effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The mechanists' workshop was filled with the sound of tools clinking and machines humming.

meanings.definition: A group of individuals who adhere to the principles of mechanism.
meanings.sent1: The mechanists in the society shared a common interest in mechanical principles.
meanings.sent2: The annual conference brought together mechanists from all over the world.
meanings.sent3: The mechanists' club had a strict rule: always think in terms of cause and effect.
meanings.sent4: Their team was like a well-oiled machine, each member a dedicated mechanist.
meanings.sent5: The mechanists' dedication to mechanism was evident in their detailed discussions.
